18.m: But to all who did receive him, who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God, who were born, not of blood nor of the will of the flesh nor of the will of man, but of God. - John 1:12-13 (ESV)

l.q: What was said about the Word in the Bible reading?
l.a: The Word was with God in the beginning. The Word was God. Everything was made through him. He is the life and the light of men. He became man and lived with men. But his own people did not receive him.

l.q: What is the difference between what was given through Moses and what was given through Christ?
l.a: The law was given through Moses. Under the law, people need to offer sacrifices for the forgiveness of their sins and guilt. Jesus Christ is the fulfillment of the law. He is the ultimate sacrifice and dies for our sins. He is God's grace and truth.

l.q: What happens to those who receive and believe in Christ?
l.a: To all who received Jesus Christ and believed in his name, He gave the right to become children of God.

18.p: Heavenly Father, I may not be an Israelite; I am not a part of your chosen race. But your word is clear - that I am made a part of your family because I have received Christ and believed in Him. Thank you for adopting me as your son. What a blessing. It doesn't matter anymore if may not like me or reject me. As long as I am right with you, I already have everything.
